#Text=Charles HaUe From " Pastoral Sonata " Beethoven, i Andante—Full Orchestra In A fiat Mozart.
#Text=Sims Reeves " The Last Rose of Summer " Grandeßhapsodie Hongroise, Pianoforte—Mr.
#Text=The programme of Wednesday evening numbered j few pieces, and did not require a great amount of leiter| press, but it was not on that account any less attractive or | important than usual.
#Text=The instrumental portion waß the i most interesting.
#Text=It commenced with a symphony which has not b?
#Text=en heard before at theee concerts, but one which we do not doubt we shall bear again, as it is one that well deserves repetition.
#Text=Equally interesting was Spohrs dramatic concerto for the violin, which was exceedingly well played by Mr.
#Text=Carrodus, who was loudly applauded at the conclusion.

#Text=The first part concluded with the overture to Iphigenia in Aulis, not as Gluck wrote it in the opera, but with a substitution of several bars at the termination, so as to form a close in the full harmony of the key.

#Text=Halles admirable rendering of the movements from Beethovens pastoral symphony, and a " Grande Rhapsodic Hongroise," by the eccentric Liszt, rendered the pianoforte selection the most attractive; but the overtures, and most of all, the beautiful andante by Mozart, prevented any charge of insignificance being brought against the orchestral pieces.

#Text=Sims Reeves was encored in "The stolen kiss," which he repeated; the same compliment was paid to his interpretation of the Irish ballad, but he declined to accede to the demand for its repetition.
#Text=The last concert for the season of the Manchester Choral Society takes place next Wednesday, so that the next of Mr.
#Text=Halles concerts cannot be given until the 21st, when Beethovena-grand symphony in D major will be performed, and Mr.
#Text=Charles Halle will play Mozarts concerto in D minor, &c.
#Text=The principal vocalist is to be Madlle.
#Text=Euphrosine Parepa, who has been singing in London with th&s, greatest success.
